title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced for stealing and depositing checks from the mail in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 in restitution; Baez got two years and owes $10,285.
The scheme involved stealing checks, altering them, and fraudulently depositing them into controlled accounts between June 2023 and February 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, previously detained by ICE, invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained by ICE in May 2025 while on his way to volleyball practice due to visa expiry.
Gomes' arrest sparked protests; he described poor detention conditions before release on $2,000 bond.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman conceded a center-ice goal but Team USA defeated Denmark in Olympic preliminary hockey.
Swayman humorously responded to the goal, citing his colorblindness, despite speculation about black boards affecting visibility.
Team USA has strong goalie options with Connor Hellebuyck and Jake Oettinger, and one exhibition game left before the tournament.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a return from his Achilles injury, missing the All-Star weekend for the first time in six years.
Kevin Durant expects Tatum to play at an All-Star level upon return, drawing from his own Achilles rehab experience.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's return will make the Celtics a major playoff threat without disrupting the current lineup.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space to pursue key free agents this offseason.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential targets for the Patriots.
Patriots may also consider Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Bills C Connor McGovern for upgrades.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have formed a partnership making ESPN the new streaming home for MLB.TV's out-of-market games.
Subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can purchase MLB.TV for $134.99 as an add-on; non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
New MLB.TV subscribers must register via the ESPN app; ESPN Unlimited is not required after the free trial to maintain MLB.TV access.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Ron Harper Jr. says Jayson Tatum played well in a recent practice with the Celtics' G League affiliate.
Tatum is recovering from an Achilles tear and is yet to have a confirmed return date this season.
Tatum participated in five-on-five scrimmages, fueling speculation about his potential return this year.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub study of educational attainment.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults have a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% hold a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest in education.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is being auctioned, closing February 21, with a starting bid of $3.9 million.
The card's history traces back to Morton Bernstein in the early 1900s and has been held by his family for 116 years.
Auctioneer Ken Goldin, featured on Netflix, highlights its significance due to its rarity and connection to Taunton, Massachusetts.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman, aged 27, did not start in the 4 Nations Face-Off but helped win the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Swayman's 2025-26 season includes 22 wins, a 2.92 GAA, and .903 save percentage; Connor Hellebuyck to back him up.
